intro: Pneumonanthe spathacea, commonly known as the spathaceous lungwort, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Commelinaceae, which includes plants known for their showy inflorescences. The plant features striking, lance-shaped leaves with a velvety texture and clusters of small, white or pink flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and greenhouses.
